1.description: The Dragon Reborn, wielding immense power but struggling with the taint on saidin. Shows increasing hardness and detachment.

13.description: Campaigns against the Seanchan with a massive army, determined to drive them from Illian and Altara.

1.description: A blacksmith turned lord, able to communicate with wolves. Deeply devoted to his wife Faile.

26.description: Devastated by Faile's capture by the Shaido Aiel, begins planning her rescue with desperate determination.

3.description: A reluctant hero with ancient memories of battles and luck that defies probability. Commands the Band of the Red Hand.

28.description: Leads his forces in the massive battle, using his tactical genius and ter'angreal to devastating effect.

15.description: The young Amyrlin Seat of the rebel Aes Sedai, determined to reunite the White Tower and depose Elaida.
15.role: Amyrlin Seat of rebel Aes Sedai

25.description: Begins the siege of Tar Valon, positioning her forces to blockade the White Tower and force Elaida's surrender.

2.description: Former Wisdom of Emond's Field, now an Aes Sedai of tremendous power, especially in Healing.

6.description: Uses the Bowl of Winds to fix the weather, wielding more of the One Power than almost anyone has ever channeled.
6.role: Circle leader for Bowl of Winds

2.description: Daughter-Heir of Andor and Aes Sedai, committed to her duties to both the White Tower and her nation.

31.description: Returns to Caemlyn to claim the Lion Throne, facing the complex politics of Andoran succession.

2.description: A Maiden of the Spear learning to be a Wise One, with great potential in channeling the One Power.

6.description: Plays a crucial role in the Bowl of Winds circle, contributing her strength to fix the weather.

2.description: A legendary archer ripped from Tel'aran'rhiod, now bonded as Warder to Elayne Trakand.

1.description: The uncrowned king of Malkier, bonded Warder to Moiraine and husband to Nynaeve.
A Saldaean noblewoman married to Perrin, with a fierce and independent spirit.

26.description: Captured by the Shaido Aiel while scouting, now held prisoner in their camp.

13.description: Marshal-General of Saldaea and one of the great captains, serves as Rand's military advisor.

1.description: Green Ajah Aes Sedai who bonded Rand without his permission, now able to sense his location and condition.

12.description: A legendary Green Ajah Aes Sedai, the oldest living Aes Sedai, known for her strength and unconventional methods.

13.description: A young woman who can see auras and images around people that foretell the future, devoted to Rand.

26.description: A Shaido Wise One who has taken captives including Faile, driven by ambition and a desire for power.

13.description: One of the Forsaken, now ruling Illian as Lord Brend, commands Shadowspawn and works against the Dragon Reborn.

14.description: A former false Dragon, now one of the Asha'man and a potential rival for Rand's power.
Leader of the Black Tower and teacher of the Asha'man, a former false Dragon with his own agenda.
An elderly Asha'man with a gift for Healing, formerly a soldier and now one of Rand's most trusted men.
A young Asha'man from Arafel, loyal to Rand and increasingly skilled in the One Power.
A young Asha'man, one of Rand's dedicated followers in the Black Tower.
An Asha'man who appears somewhat absent-minded but is actually quite dangerous and skilled.
A young Asha'man, eager and loyal to Rand, showing promise in his abilities.
An Asha'man with the rank of Tsorovan'm'hael, ambitious and potentially dangerous.
An Asha'man officer, stern and disciplined, but with his own ambitions within the Black Tower.
An Asha'man dedicated to serving Rand, though his loyalties may not be entirely clear.
An Asha'man who appears loyal but may harbor hidden motivations regarding Rand.

15.description: Former Mistress of Novices, now Keeper of the Chronicles to Egwene's rebel Amyrlin Seat.
Former Amyrlin Seat, now stilled and working as advisor to Egwene and the rebel Aes Sedai.
Former Keeper of the Chronicles to Siuan, now stilled and changed in personality, working with the rebels.
Former Captain-General of Andor, now Lord Captain Commander of the rebel Aes Sedai army.
Blue Ajah Aes Sedai and member of Egwene's inner circle of advisors in the rebel camp.
Gray Ajah Aes Sedai among the rebels, known for her skill in law and negotiation.
White Ajah Aes Sedai in the rebel camp, known for her logical and methodical approach.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai among the rebels, devoted to scholarly pursuits and knowledge.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai among the rebels, known for her multiple Warders and battle-readiness.
Yellow Ajah Aes Sedai in the rebel camp, focused on Healing and the restoration of the Tower.
The Red Ajah Amyrlin Seat controlling the White Tower, opposed by the rebel Aes Sedai.

16.description: White Ajah Keeper of the Chronicles to Elaida, with significant influence in the White Tower.

17.description: Brown Ajah Aes Sedai serving in the White Tower under Elaida's rule.
White Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, known for her logical approach and investigative mind.
Red Ajah Aes Sedai serving Elaida, involved in Tower politics and the hunt for male channelers.
Red Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, determined and focused on her duties to the Ajah.
Gray Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, involved in the complex politics of the divided Tower.
Yellow Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, dedicated to Healing and maintaining Tower traditions.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, scholarly and dedicated to preserving knowledge.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai in the White Tower, maintaining the facade of loyalty while harboring secrets.

1.description: The First of Mayene, a beautiful and politically astute ruler who has formed an alliance with Rand.

26.description: Works with Perrin to plan the rescue of Faile and the other captives from the Shaido.
Red Ajah Aes Sedai held captive by the Shaido, forced to serve as their 'Wise One.'

1.description: Clan chief of the Taardad Aiel, one of Rand's most trusted advisors and loyal supporters.

13.description: Clan chief of the Tomanelle Aiel, fighting alongside Rand against the Seanchan forces.
Clan chief of the Reyn Aiel, committed to following the Car'a'carn in battle.
Clan chief of the Shaarad Aiel, another of the chiefs following Rand into war.
Clan chief of the Miagoma Aiel, leading his warriors in the campaign against the Seanchan.
Clan chief of the Daryne Aiel, participating in Rand's military campaigns.

1.description: A Wise One of the Nine Valleys sept of the Taardad Aiel, one of Aviendha's teachers.
Ancient Wise One of the Haido sept of the Shaarad Aiel, one of Aviendha's most demanding teachers.
A Wise One of the Jhirad sept of the Goshien Aiel, teaching Aviendha in the ways of the Wise Ones.
The oldest and most respected Wise One, wielding great authority among all the Aiel clans.
A former Maiden of the Spear who gave up the spear to become one of Rand's servants, though she maintains her fierce nature.
A Maiden of the Spear who serves as one of Rand's guards, fiercely protective of the Car'a'carn.
A young Maiden of the Spear serving as one of Rand's guards, eager to prove herself in battle.
A Maiden of the Spear and one of Rand's dedicated guards, known for her sharp tongue and fierce loyalty.
A Maiden of the Spear serving as one of Rand's guards, committed to protecting the Dragon Reborn.

2.description: Gray Ajah Aes Sedai who was part of the embassy to Rand, now held captive by the Aiel.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai who was part of the embassy, now captive and being taught by Wise Ones.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai who was sent to Rand, now held captive by the Wise Ones.
White Ajah Aes Sedai who was part of the embassy to Rand, now being held and taught by the Wise Ones.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai from the embassy, now captive and learning hard lessons from the Wise Ones.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai who came to Rand independently, now held by the Wise Ones alongside the embassy sisters.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai who came with Kiruna, now also held captive and being instructed by the Wise Ones.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai who bonded Rand, now held with the other sisters and learning Aiel ways.
Gray Ajah Aes Sedai who was part of the embassy, now captive and being taught by the Wise Ones.
Gray Ajah Aes Sedai who led the embassy to Rand, now sworn to him and serving as an advisor.
Blue Ajah Aes Sedai who was part of the embassy, now sworn to Rand and serving his cause.
Brown Ajah Aes Sedai from the embassy, now sworn to Rand and contributing her scholarly knowledge.
Green Ajah Aes Sedai who came with Kiruna, now sworn to Rand and serving his interests.

1.description: Gray Ajah Aes Sedai advisor to Berelain, skilled in negotiation and political maneuvering.
Captain of Berelain's Winged Guards, a skilled soldier with an eyepatch, loyal to the First of Mayene.

13.description: A Cairhienin lord who has sworn fealty to Rand, helping to govern Cairhien in his absence.
A Cairhienin noblewoman who has sworn to Rand, though her loyalty may not be entirely genuine.

2.description: A Sea Folk Windfinder of considerable strength and skill, participating in the use of the Bowl of Winds.
A Sea Folk Wavemistress, sister to Shalon, involved in the negotiations and agreements with Rand.
Sea Folk Windfinder of great strength, plays a key role in the Bowl of Winds circle.
Sea Folk Windfinder working with the circle to use the Bowl of Winds to fix the weather.
The Mistress of the Ships, the highest ranking Sea Folk leader, involved in major negotiations.
A Sea Folk Wavemistress participating in the Bowl of Winds working and subsequent negotiations.
Windfinder to the Mistress of the Ships, one of the most powerful Sea Folk channelers.

3.description: A Cairhienin lord and Mat's second-in-command of the Band of the Red Hand, dry-witted and utterly loyal.
A Tairen lord serving with the Band of the Red Hand, one of Mat's capable officers.
An officer in the Band of the Red Hand, experienced and reliable in Mat's campaigns.
A former smuggler and poacher, now Mat's chief scout, with unmatched skills in stealth and observation.
A soldier in the Band of the Red Hand, one of Mat's reliable men from the early days.
A soldier serving with the Band, known for his reliability and skill in battle.
An experienced soldier in the Band of the Red Hand, trusted by Mat for important missions.
A member of the Band of the Red Hand, participating in Mat's military campaigns.
A Cairhienin member of the Band, serving under Mat's command with dedication.
A soldier in Mat's Band, known for his courage and loyalty in battle.
An officer in the Band of the Red Hand, experienced in tactics and battlefield command.
A Tairen lord serving with the Band, bringing noble leadership to Mat's forces.
A Cairhienin lord serving as an officer in the Band of the Red Hand.
A member of the Band of the Red Hand, fighting alongside Mat in his campaigns.
A soldier in the Band, participating in Mat's military operations with skill and bravery.

2.description: The proprietor of a traveling circus, providing cover for Nynaeve and Elayne during their journey.
A strongman in Luca's circus, performing feats of strength and helping maintain order.
A performer in Luca's circus, part of the traveling show that provides cover for the Aes Sedai.
A gleeman and former Court Bard, now traveling with Nynaeve and Elayne, skilled in many arts.
A thief-catcher from Tear, now serving as guard and investigator for Nynaeve and Elayne.

3.description: A young boy whose parents were killed by bandits, now adopted by Mat and the Band of the Red Hand.
An old man with many stories of adventures, now traveling with Mat and serving as a storyteller.

6.description: Son of the Queen of Altara, heir to the throne and involved in the political situation in Ebou Dar.
Queen of Altara, ruler of Ebou Dar, dealing with the presence of Aes Sedai and the Bowl of Winds.
High-ranking Seanchan noble leading the Seanchan forces, with her own ambitious agenda.
A Seanchan of extremely high rank, traveling incognito in Ebou Dar for unknown purposes.
A Seanchan woman serving as bodyguard and companion to Tuon, skilled in combat.
A Seanchan Truthspeaker, serving in an advisory capacity with the ability to speak harsh truths.
Captain of the Seanchan Deathwatch Guard, elite protectors of the highest Seanchan nobility.
A member of the Seanchan Deathwatch Guard, elite soldiers sworn to protect the Blood.
A Seanchan guard serving with the Deathwatch Guard, dedicated to protecting the Blood.

recaps.1: The prologue shows various viewpoints as the world prepares for the final conflict. Deathwatch Guards discover an intruder in the Seanchan palace.
recaps.2: Nynaeve, Elayne, and Aviendha work with the Sea Folk and other channelers to prepare the Bowl of Winds for use.
recaps.3: Mat leads the Band of the Red Hand in continued military operations while dealing with his growing reputation and responsibilities.
recaps.4: Preparations continue for using the Bowl of Winds, with complex negotiations between various factions of channelers.
recaps.5: Political maneuvering in Ebou Dar continues as various groups position themselves around the use of the Bowl.
recaps.6: The Bowl of Winds is finally used in a massive working involving many channelers, successfully beginning to fix the weather patterns.
recaps.7: The aftermath of the Bowl's use creates new challenges and opportunities, while political situations shift across the region.
recaps.8: Various factions react to the successful use of the Bowl, with some pleased and others concerned about the implications.
recaps.9: Mat deals with the consequences of the Bowl's use while managing his military responsibilities and personal relationships.
recaps.10: The effects of the weather working begin to be felt across the land, while various characters deal with changing circumstances.
recaps.11: Political and military situations continue to evolve as characters adapt to the new weather patterns and their implications.
recaps.12: Final preparations are made for major military movements as various forces position themselves for coming conflicts.
recaps.13: Rand begins his campaign against the Seanchan, leading massive forces including Asha'man and Aiel in coordinated attacks.
recaps.14: The military campaign continues with Rand employing both conventional tactics and the One Power against Seanchan positions.
recaps.15: Egwene consolidates her position as Amyrlin of the rebel Aes Sedai while planning the siege of Tar Valon.
recaps.16: Political maneuvering continues in both the rebel camp and the White Tower as the division deepens.
recaps.17: Various Aes Sedai in the White Tower work on their own agendas while the institution faces its greatest crisis.
recaps.18: The rebel Aes Sedai finalize their preparations for the siege while dealing with internal politics and logistics.
recaps.19: Both sides of the Aes Sedai division prepare for the confrontation that will determine the Tower's future.
recaps.20: Military and political preparations reach their climax as various forces move toward decisive action.
recaps.21: The siege preparations intensify while various characters deal with the personal costs of the coming conflict.
recaps.22: Final positioning takes place as the rebel army moves into position around Tar Valon for the siege.
recaps.23: The siege of Tar Valon begins in earnest with the rebels establishing their blockade and control of approaches.
recaps.24: Rand's campaign against the Seanchan reaches a critical juncture with major battles and strategic decisions.
recaps.25: The siege of Tar Valon is fully established while Egwene works to maintain unity among the diverse rebel forces.
recaps.26: Perrin discovers that Faile has been captured by the Shaido Aiel, throwing him into despair and desperate planning.
recaps.27: Perrin begins organizing a rescue mission for Faile while dealing with his own emotional turmoil and the political situation.
recaps.28: Mat leads the Band in a major battle, using all his tactical skills and luck to achieve victory against difficult odds.
recaps.29: The battle reaches its climax with decisive action from Rand, his Asha'man, and allied forces against the enemy.
recaps.30: The aftermath of the major battle creates new political and military realities that will shape future conflicts.
recaps.31: Elayne returns to Caemlyn to claim the Lion Throne of Andor, beginning the complex process of securing her succession.
